message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS. 

The paper deals with the design objectives of distributed storage systems, which involves information theory (cs.IT), distributed computing (cs.DC), network infrastructure (cs.NI), system implementation (cs.SI), and data storage (cs.DS). The focus on minimizing data traffic during repair suggests a strong emphasis on network infrastructure and distributed computing, making cs.NI and cs.DC likely categories. The use of regenerating codes and the proof technique involving a max-flow-min-cut-type theorem suggest information theory and data storage as relevant categories, making cs.IT and cs.DS likely categories as well. Finally, the explicit constructions given in the paper may also be of interest to researchers in system implementation, making cs.SI a possible category.
